author: Ryan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2020
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.           The good part: as a light this device works well.  It has three brightness levels and three color levels.  All work well.The bad news: I have migrated to USB-C chargers and bought this device specifically because it was advertised as USB Type-C.  However, I tried multiple OEM certified USB-C chargers and USB-C to USB-C cables; when plugged in, none of these would power the device (see video/photos).  The device comes with an included cable which appears to be USB-C on one end, but actually plugs into a USB-A charger on the other end.  This included cable is the only thing that would successfully charge the device.If you are choosing this model because it is USB-C, then don't.  It will not work with normal USB chargers and cables, and will require you to travel with a USB-A wall charger in order to accommodate the included cable.  If you don't mind using a USB-A charger, this device will likely work well for you with the included proprietary cable.In the end, I tried three of these neck reading lights: Frishare, Glocusent (this one), and Vekkia.  Of those three, I'm keeping the Vekkia.The Frishare one is relatively light weight, the lights work well as advertised, and it comes with a nice hardened case, which is really it's primary benefit.  However, the rubber arms are thicker than other models and it is a bit bulkier.  Moreover, when you bend the flexible arms I immediately could see the rubber pull off of the battery casing, making the wiring visible (see photo).As noted above, I tried the Glocusent.  It worked well but had two main problems.  It is less flexible with a bigger battery pack in the back, and it doesn't work with USB-C chargers (see above).In the end I settled for the Vekkia neck light.  It is light weight with thinner arms than the Frishare.  Admittedly all of them are cheap lights, but the Vekkia appears better made at first glance, given that the Frishare had exposed wires.  The Vekkia charged fine with my own USB-C to micro-USB cables.  The lowest brightness setting on the Vekkia is also lower than the Frishare or Glocusent, meaning you have the option of less light when your spouse is sleeping.

review_content: This thing is quite possibly the best thing I’ve been gifted in years.I do a lot of coloring. And my eyesight isn’t great. I need pretty much ask the light I can get. author: Gnorb

author: Alice
